isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 ENGINES - OPERATION - ATA Data Link Connector

svcproc.title: ATA Data Link Connector
svcproc.para: The six pin ATA data link connector (137) allows an electronic service tool (EST) to communicate with the ECM. The data link carries serial data transmissions between the ECM and the electronic service tool and between the ECM and the speedo/tachometer and the EST.

The ATA data link connector (137), which is located on the left instrument panel, has circuits in four of the six cavities. The data link circuits are a twisted wire pair because twisting the wires helps shield them from interference. The circuits are as follows:

item.para: Circuit 98A(+) is the positive data link connection and it is fed by the positive data link connector (514), the jumper bus bar, circuit 98(+), connector (190), and circuit 98(+) coming from the ECM connector (273).

Circuit 98C(-) is the negative data link connection and it is fed by the negative data link connector (515), the jumper bus bar, circuit 98B(-), connector (190), and circuit 98B(-) coming from the ECM connector (273).
Circuit 97D is a 12 volt circuit and is fed from B1 Battery Stud to circuit 14W and 14AA, through 20A fuse F5-D. Thus it provides power for the electrical service tool.
Circuits 97-GR and 11-GT are connected to the panel lights ground adapter (506), and provide a ground for the electronic service tool.
